Entries.default: This soul flits about in hasty, panicked bursts. It eases closer to you with anticipation.
No one believes the Huana could have forged a device like the golden wheel, but you stay silent on the matter. The Engwithans built more for function than beauty, and this is art.

They laughed at your hours studying the runic script of the ancient Huana, but here you are poring over gold inscriptions while they scratch their heads. 

You promise yourself a good boast on the journey back to Neketaka.
Rotating the control disc and pressing panels had you so engrossed that you mistakenly entered the wrong combination.

A slit opened in the disc, discharging a gas that brought you to your knees coughing loud enough to summon a creature whose shape you could barely perceive through the haze of pain.

Boasting would have to wait.
Emitting a palpable feeling of relief, the essence drifts into Xoti's lantern.
